data.md:MetaData: (Table 1) Borings chips and/or borings of the ichnogenus Entobia at DSDP Hole 74-526A
Evidence of Clionid sponges in sediments of the Walvis Ridge, southeastern Atlantic Site 526, Deep Sea Drilling Project Leg 74

Pelagic carbonate oozes of DSDP Site 526 contain remnants of the activity of boring sponges of the family Clionidae: (1) the borings themselves = ichnogenus Entobia and (2) the characteristically shaped boring chips as a finegrained sediment component.
46 cores, 200.8 m cored, 0 m drilled, 101.2 % recovery
